event.summary: 03/08/1993: The Irish Republican Army (IRA) conducted a mortar attack on a security base in Northern Ireland that resulted in three injuries and one death.
event.target1: British troops at the Joint police-military base in Keady
event.target2: Royal Ulster Constabulary police force at the Joint police-military base in Keady
event.weapdetail: A type of mortar bombs called Mark-15 "barrack busters" were used in the attack. The Mark-15 mortar can carry 500lb of explosives up to 150 yards at a height of 60ft.
event.propcomment: Dozens of buildings around the station were damaged, but the base itself sustained only minor damage.
event.addnotes: Nigel McCollum was the fourth employee of the building firm, Henry Brothers, to be killed in an IRA attack. Henry Brothers has refused the IRA's warning to abstain from working with security forces. The attack was the third of its kind on security forces in the last 24 hours. Four injuries and one casualty resulted from the attack.
